\section{common manipulations}
\label{\detokenize{content/notebook/example:common-manipulations}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabulary}{\linewidth}[t]{|T|T|T|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Target
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Command
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Description
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
adding column (opt.1)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df{[}'new\_col1'{]} = list}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Adding list to existing DataFrame as a new column at the end
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
adding column (opt.2)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.insert(2, 'new\_col2', list) }}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Insert list to existing DataFrame as a new column at specific position
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
filter df
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.filter()}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Select columns or rows by name, regex
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
filter df by column values (opt.1)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.query("Color == 'Blue'")}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Filter based on a query string
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
filter df by column values (opt.2)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df{[}list\_bool{]}}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Filter by a given list of Booleans, like list\_bool = {[}True, False, True, â€¦{]}
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
drop column (opt.1)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.drop(columns={[}'col1', 'col2'{]})}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Drop column by giving list of column names
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
drop columns (opt.2)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.pop('col\_name')}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Drop a column and return the dropped column
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
drop rows
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.drop(index={[}0,2{]})}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Drop rows based on list of index
\\
\hline
\sphinxAtStartPar
drop NA
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{df.dropna()}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Drop the rows where at least one element is missing
\\
\hline
\end{tabulary}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} will change df!}

\PYG{n}{df}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{new\PYGZus{}col1}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{new\PYGZus{}col\PYGZus{}list}
\PYG{n}{df}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n}{df}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
